alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:21AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Clayton, southern Fayette and southern Grant Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 219 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cassville to near Fairbank. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall, Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Guttenberg and Cassville around 225 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Big H Campground, Camp C.S. Klaus, Mederville, Highways 3 And 187, Turkey River, Bixby State Park, Highway 13 And County C 24, Cornelia, Fairview and Burton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
